user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_QueueDelete:
```c
int32 OS_QueueDelete(osal_id_t queue_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, queue_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_QueueDelete_Impl(&token);

        /* Complete the operation via the common routine */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete(return_code, &token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_QueueDelete:
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no uses of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided code fragment. The function and related tokens use only standard C constructs: normal typedef-based integer types, plain function definition and calls, standard address-of operator (&token), integer constant macro (OS_SUCCESS), block comments, and a normal return statement. There are no occurrences of common compiler extensions such as identifiers or keywords with double underscores (e.g. __attribute__, __asm__, __builtin_*, __extension__), nested functions, statement-expressions ({ ... }), typeof, labels-as-values, anonymous/unnamed structs/unions as an extension, inline assembly, or other documented compiler-specific constructs. Therefore there are no code fragments here that need further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (use of language extensions).
